info.title: U.S. EPA Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) - Corporate Compliance Screener Rest Services
info.description:
Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) is a tool developed and maintained by EPA's Office of Enforcement and Compliance Assurance for public use. ECHO provides integrated compliance and enforcement information for over one million regulated facilities nationwide. The Corporate Compliance Screener organizes existing ECHO facility data into reports that highlight recent compliance issues or enforcement actions based upon data entered into national data systems of record. 

For guidance, please see https://echo.epa.gov/help/corporate-compliance-screener/corporate-compliance-screener-help#results.

contact.name: US EPA, OECA Integration, Targeting and Access Branch

license.name: This page was built with the Swagger API.

q.output.name: output
q.output.description:
Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- JSON = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation (default).
- JSONP = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation with Padding.  
- XML = Data model formatted as Extensible Markup Language.

f.output.name: output
f.output.description:
Output Format Flag.  Enter one of the following keywords:
- JSON = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation (default).
- JSONP = Data model formatted as Javascript Object Notation with Padding.  
- XML = Data model formatted as Extensible Markup Language.

q.p_active.name: p_active
q.p_active.description: Active Facilities Flag.  Provide Y to filter results to facilities that are active.

f.p_active.name: p_active
f.p_active.description: Active Facilities Flag.  Provide Y to filter results to facilities that are active.

q.p_fn.name: p_fn
q.p_fn.description: Facility Name Filter. Enter one or more case-insensitive facility names to filter results.  Provide multiple values as a comma-delimited list.  See p_fntype for additional modifiers.

f.p_fn_excl.name: p_fn_excl
f.p_fn_excl.description: Facility Name to Exclude Filter. Enter one or more case-insensitive facility names to exclude from results.  Provide multiple values as a comma-delimited list.  See p_fntype for additional modifiers.

q.p_fn_excl.name: p_fn_excl
q.p_fn_excl.description: Facility Name to Exclude Filter. Enter one or more case-insensitive facility names to exclude from results.  Provide multiple values as a comma-delimited list.  See p_fntype for additional modifiers.

f.p_fn.name: p_fn
f.p_fn.description: Facility Name Filter. Enter one or more case-insensitive facility names to filter results.  Provide multiple values as a comma-delimited list.  See p_fntype for additional modifiers.

q.callback.name: callback
q.callback.description: JSONP Callback.  For use with JSONP and GEOJSONP output only.  Enter a name of the function in which to wrap the JSON response.

f.callback.name: callback
f.callback.description: JSONP Callback.  For use with JSONP and GEOJSONP output only.  Enter a name of the function in which to wrap the JSON response.

q.p_yrs.name: p_yrs
q.p_yrs.description: Provide the number of years to limits results by the settlement entered date.

f.p_yrs.name: p_yrs
f.p_yrs.description: Provide the number of years to limits results by the settlement entered date.

q.p_st.name: p_st
q.p_st.description: Facility State and State-Equivalent Filter.  Provide one or more USPS postal abbreviations for states and state-equivalents to filter results.  Provide multiple values as a comma-delimited list.

f.p_st.name: p_st
f.p_st.description: Facility State and State-Equivalent Filter.  Provide one or more USPS postal abbreviations for states and state-equivalents to filter results.  Provide multiple values as a comma-delimited list.

q.p_frs.name: p_frs
q.p_frs.description: Facility Registry Service ID Filter. Enter a single 12-digit FRS identifier to filter results.

f.p_frs.name: p_frs
f.p_frs.description: Facility Registry Service ID Filter. Enter a single 12-digit FRS identifier to filter results.

q.p_reg.name: p_reg
q.p_reg.description: EPA Region Filter. Provide a single value of 01 thru 10 to restrict results to a single EPA region.

f.p_reg.name: p_reg
f.p_reg.description: EPA Region Filter. Provide a single value of 01 thru 10 to restrict results to a single EPA region.

q.queryset.name: queryset
q.queryset.description: Query Limiter.  Enter a value to limit the number of records returned for each query. Value cannot exceed 70,000.

f.queryset.name: queryset
f.queryset.description: Query Limiter.  Enter a value to limit the number of records returned for each query. Value cannot exceed 70,000.

q.responseset.name: responseset
q.responseset.description: Response Set Limiter. Enter a value to limit the number of records per page. Value cannot exceed 1,000.

f.responseset.name: responseset
f.responseset.description: Response Set Limiter. Enter a value to limit the number of records per page. Value cannot exceed 1,000.

q.p_pid.name: p_pid
q.p_pid.description: Nine-digit permit IDs. May contain up to 2000 comma-separated values.

f.p_pid.name: p_pid
f.p_pid.description: Nine-digit permit IDs. May contain up to 2000 comma-separated values.

q.p_fntype.name: p_fntype
q.p_fntype.description:
Controls type of text search performed on facility name with parameter p_fn.
- EXACT = Find facilities having the exact provided name(s).
- BEGINS = Find facilities with names starting with the provided term(s).
- ALL = Find facilities using Oracle text search terms.
- CONTAINS =

f.p_fntype.name: p_fntype
f.p_fntype.description:
Controls type of text search performed on facility name with parameter p_fn.
- EXACT = Find facilities having the exact provided name(s).
- BEGINS = Find facilities with names starting with the provided term(s).
- ALL = Find facilities using Oracle text search terms.
- CONTAINS =

q.tablelist.name: tablelist
q.tablelist.description: Table List Flag. Enter a Y to display the first page of facility results.

f.tablelist.name: tablelist
f.tablelist.description: Table List Flag. Enter a Y to display the first page of facility results.

q.summarylist.name: summarylist
q.summarylist.description: Summary List Flag.  Enter a Y to return a list of summary statistics based on the parameters submitted to the query service.

f.summarylist.name: summarylist
f.summarylist.description: Summary List Flag.  Enter a Y to return a list of summary statistics based on the parameters submitted to the query service.

q.qid.name: qid
q.qid.description: Query ID Selector.  Enter the QueryID number from a previously run query.

f.qid.name: qid
f.qid.description: Query ID Selector.  Enter the QueryID number from a previously run query.

q.pageno.name: pageno
q.pageno.description: Indicates the number of the page to display. It is used only when the results are paginated.

f.pageno.name: pageno
f.pageno.description: Indicates the number of the page to display. It is used only when the results are paginated.

q.newsort.name: newsort
q.newsort.description: Output Sort Column.  Enter the number of the column on which the data will be sorted. If unpopulated results will sort on the first column.

f.newsort.name: newsort
f.newsort.description: Output Sort Column.  Enter the number of the column on which the data will be sorted. If unpopulated results will sort on the first column.

q.descending.name: descending
q.descending.description: Output Sort Column Descending Flag.  Enter Y to column identified in the newsort parameter descending.  Enter N to use ascending sort order. Used only when newsort parameter is populated.

f.descending.name: descending
f.descending.description: Output Sort Column Descending Flag.  Enter Y to column identified in the newsort parameter descending.  Enter N to use ascending sort order. Used only when newsort parameter is populated.

q.queryid.name: queryid
q.queryid.description: Query ID Selector.  Enter the QueryID number from a previously run query.

f.queryid.name: queryid
f.queryid.description: Query ID Selector.  Enter the QueryID number from a previously run query.

q.qcolumns.name: qcolumns
q.qcolumns.description: Used to customize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.

f.qcolumns.name: qcolumns
f.qcolumns.description: Used to customize service output.  A list of comma-separated column IDs of output objects that will be returned in the service query object or download.  Use the metadata service endpoint for a complete list of Ids and definitions.

get.description: Validates query search parameters and returns query identifier.  Use the responseset parameter to set the page size

200.description: Returns an object that includes summary statistics and an array of facilities and cases that match the selected criteria.

post.description: Validates query search parameters and returns query identifier.  Use the responseset parameter to set the page size

200.description: Returns an object that includes summary statistics and an array of facilities and cases that match the selected criteria.

get.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener Search by Query ID
get.description: GET_QID is passed with a query ID corresponding to a previously run get_facilities query. It then returns a Facility object containing all matching facilities and cases. The main purpose of GET_QID is for large querysets that contain multiple pages (responsesets) of output. GET_QID allows for pagination and for the selection and sorting of columns.

200.description: Results are an array (page) of facilities with the number of facilities and cases equal to the responseset (page size).

post.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener Search by Query ID
post.description: GET_QID is passed with a query ID corresponding to a previously run get_facilities query. It then returns a Facility object containing all matching facilities and cases. The main purpose of GET_QID is for large querysets that contain multiple pages (responsesets) of output. GET_QID allows for pagination and for the selection and sorting of columns.

200.description: Results are an array (page) of facilities with the number of facilities and cases equal to the responseset (page size).

get.description: This procedure is the overall service for the Corporate Compliance Screener Report. It returns all of the data displayed in the web report by invoking individual procedures that each return a targeted portion of the report.

200.description: Returns a complex object containing facility violation information, EPA and State formal enforcement settlements, and EPA "open" civil enforcement cases for the provided search identifier (qid).

post.description: This procedure is the overall service for the Corporate Compliance Screener Report. It returns all of the data displayed in the web report by invoking individual procedures that each return a targeted portion of the report.

200.description: Returns a complex object containing facility violation information, EPA and State formal enforcement settlements, and EPA "open" civil enforcement cases for the provided search identifier (qid).

get.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener Current Facility Violation Information Service
get.description: Based on the queryid obtained from get_facilities returns a JSON object containing facility with current violations.

200.description: Returns an object that includes facility-level information for facilities that have any known violation(s) in the most recent quarter.

post.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener Current Facility Violation Information Service
post.description: Based on the queryid obtained from get_facilities returns a JSON object containing facility with current violations.

200.description: Returns an object that includes facility-level information for facilities that have any known violation(s) in the most recent quarter.

get.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener EPA and State Formal Enforcement Settlements Service
get.description: Based on the queryid obtained from get_facilities returns a JSON object containing formal enforcement settlements.

200.description: Returns an object that includes case-level information for facilities or cases that have had any penalty amount and that match the selected Settlement Time Period range.

schema.description: EPA and State Formal Enforcement Settlements Object

post.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener EPA and State Formal Enforcement Settlements Service
post.description: Based on the queryid obtained from get_facilities returns a JSON object containing formal enforcement settlements.

200.description: Returns an object that includes case-level information for facilities or cases that have had any penalty amount and that match the selected Settlement Time Period range.

schema.description: EPA and State Formal Enforcement Settlements Object

get.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener EPA "Open" Civil Enforcement Cases Service
get.description: Based on the queryid obtained from get_facilities returns a JSON object containing EPA "open" civil enforcement cases.

200.description: Returns an object that includes case-level information for enforcement cases that are led by EPA and have a current case status that is considered "open" (Complaint Filed, Stayed While Under Appeal).

post.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener EPA "Open" Civil Enforcement Cases Service
post.description: Based on the queryid obtained from get_facilities returns a JSON object containing EPA "open" civil enforcement cases.

200.description: Returns an object that includes case-level information for enforcement cases that are led by EPA and have a current case status that is considered "open" (Complaint Filed, Stayed While Under Appeal).

get.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener Download Data Service
get.description: Based on the QID obtained from get_facilities returns a comma separated value (CSV) file of the facilities and cases found.

200.description: Results are a comma separated value (CSV) file.

post.summary: Corporate Compliance Screener Download Data Service
post.description: Based on the QID obtained from get_facilities returns a comma separated value (CSV) file of the facilities and cases found.

200.description: Results are a comma separated value (CSV) file.

get.description: Returns the JSON Object Name and ColumnId for usage with the qcolumns parameter for get_qid, get_facilities, and other service endpoints.

200.description: Results are an array of columns/objects.

post.description: Returns the JSON Object Name and ColumnId for usage with the qcolumns parameter for get_qid, get_facilities, and other service endpoints.

200.description: Results are an array of columns/objects.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Field to record messages (typically performance-related) about packet processing

CurrFacInfo.title: Facilities with Current Violations
CurrFacInfo.description: A complex array of facilities with current violations.

CaseDefName.title: Defendant Name
CaseDefName.description: The name of the defendant, or respondent associated with the case.

CaseDefendants.title: Case Defendants
CaseDefendants.description: An array of case defendants related to the facility or case.

City.title: City
City.description: The name of the city, town, village or other locality, when identifiable, within whose boundaries (the majority of) the facility site is located. This is not always the same as the city used for USPS mail delivery.

State.title: State
State.description: The two letter abbreviation that represents the state or state equivalent for the U.S.

EPARegion.title: EPA Region
EPARegion.description: The EPA region in which the facility is located

IcisAirNames.title: Clean Air Act (CAA) Facility Name(s)
IcisAirNames.description: Alternate facility name(s), as maintained in the CAA database.

CamdNames.title: Clean Air Markets Division (CAMD) Facility Name(s)
CamdNames.description: Alternate facility name(s), as maintained in the CAMD database.

EisNames.title: Emission Inventory System (EIS) Facility Name(s)
EisNames.description: Alternate facility name(s), as maintained in the EIS database.

CWANames.title: Clean Water Act (CWA) Facility Name(s)
CWANames.description: Alternate facility name(s), as maintained in the CWA database.

RCRANames.title: Resources Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) Facility Name(s)
RCRANames.description: Alternate facility name(s), as maintained in the RCRA database.

SDWANames.title: Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA) Facility Name(s)
SDWANames.description: Alternate facility name(s), as maintained in the SDWA database.

TRINames.title: Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) Facility Name(s)
TRINames.description: Alternate facility name(s), as maintained in the TRI database.

TscaNames.title: Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) Facility Name(s)
TscaNames.description: Alternate facility name(s), as maintained in the TSCA database.

NPDESIDs.title: ICS-NPDES Clean Water Act Identifier
NPDESIDs.description: Clean Water Act ID from the ICIS-NPDES (Integrated Compliance Information System - National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)

RCRAIDs.title: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act IDs
RCRAIDs.description: A unique 12-character ID assigned for each record/permit/site/facility within the RCRAInfo database.

SDWAIDs.description: A unique 9-character ID assigned for each public water system within the Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS).

MediaPrimaryLaw.title: Statute in HPV/SNC/SV
MediaPrimaryLaw.description: The statute(s) in which the facility is currently considered a High Priority Violator (HPV), in Significant Noncompliance (SNC), or a Serious Violator (SV).

CurrSvFlag.title: Current Significant Violation Flag
CurrSvFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has a current significant violation. 1 = Yes

CurrVioFlag.title: Current Violation Flag
CurrVioFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has a current violation. 1 = Yes

FacilityCurrSNC.title: Violation Status
FacilityCurrSNC.description: An indication of the facility's current known overall compliance status.

CAACurrHpvFlag.title: Current CAA High Priority Violator (HPV) Flag
CAACurrHpvFlag.description: Indicates if the facility  currently considered a  High Priority Violator (HPV) violation under CAA.

CWACurrSNCFlag.title: Current CWA Significant Noncompliance (SNC) Flag
CWACurrSNCFlag.description: Indicates if the facility is currently considered to be in Significant Noncompliance (SNC) under CWA.

RCRACurrSNCFlag.title: Current RCRA Violation Flag
RCRACurrSNCFlag.description: Indicates if the facility is currently considered to be in Significant Noncompliance (SNC) under RCRA.

SDWACurrSNCFlag.title: Current SDWA Serious Violator (SV) Flag
SDWACurrSNCFlag.description: Indicates if the facility is currently considered to be a Serious Violator (SV) under SDWA.

QtrsInSNC.title: Quarters In Significant Noncompliance
QtrsInSNC.description: The number of formal enforcement actions that have been taken against the facility, under the corresponding statute, within the five year time period

ActionCaseTypes.title: Type of Action
ActionCaseTypes.description: Identifies the type of action based on the enforcement authority used. The current options are Administrative - Formal or Judicial.

LeadAgency.title: Lead Agency
LeadAgency.description: The lead agency (e.g., EPA, State) conducting the inspection

SettlementDate.title: Settlement Date
SettlementDate.description: For federal judicial actions, this is the date the settlement document is signed by the presiding judge and entered by the Clerk of the Court. At that point, the settlement becomes a binding court order. For administrative actions, this is the date that the final order is signed and issued by the enforcement authority.

StatusDate.title: Case Status Date
StatusDate.description: The date of the most recent milestone activity reported in the case record.

PenaltiesGt50k.title: Penalties Greater Than $50,000
PenaltiesGt50k.description: The count of penalties or injunctive relief greater than $50,000 in the past three years.

ComplyingActionValue.title: Complying Action Value
ComplyingActionValue.description: For civil enforcement actions, the value of the costs incurred by the defendant/respondent to attain compliance with the law and restore the environment. This value does not include penalties, cost recovery, or costs associated with SEPs.

SepValue.title: SEP Value
SepValue.description: For civil enforcement actions, as part of a settlement, a defendant may voluntarily agree to undertake an environmentally beneficial project (Supplement Environmental Project (SEP)) related to the violation in exchange for mitigation of the penalty to be paid.

FacCaseFlag.title: Facility or Case Flag
FacCaseFlag.description: Indicates if the record contains facility information or case information (values can be either FAC or CASE).

FacActiveFlag.title: Facility Active Flag
FacActiveFlag.description: Indicates whether any of the associated ICIS-Air, ICIS-NPDES, RCRAInfo or SDWIS permits/facilities are in an active status.

CaseCurrStatus.title: Current Case Status
CaseCurrStatus.description: The current status of the enforcement action. Status is based on the most recent milestone activity reported in the case record.

CAACurrViolFlag.title: Current CAA Violation Flag
CAACurrViolFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has a current CAA violation.

CWACurrViolFlag.title: Current CWA Violation Flag
CWACurrViolFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has a current CWA violation.

RCRACurrViolFlag.title: Current RCRA Violation Flag
RCRACurrViolFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has a current RCRA violation.

SDWACurrViolFlag.title: Current SDWA Violation Flag
SDWACurrViolFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has a current SDWA violation.

FacNaicsCodes.title: Facility NAICS Codes
FacNaicsCodes.description: The facility's North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Codes.

FacSicCodes.title: SIC Codes
FacSicCodes.description: Indicates the facility’s or permit's primary Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) Code. The SIC code describes the primary activity of the facility.

MaxScore.title: Max Score
MaxScore.description: A sorting score for internal use.

QueryID.description: Sequential number assigned to entire search result

SNCRows.description: Number of facilities with curr_sv_flag populated (CWP_STATUS = "Significant Violation")

CAARows.description: The number of facilities or cases within the result set that have Clean Air Act (CAA) permits.

CWARows.title: Clean Water Act Count

RCRRows.title: Resource Recovery and Conservation Act Count
RCRRows.description: The number of facilities or cases within the results set that have Resource Conservation and Recovery Action (RCRA) permits.

SDWARows.title: Safe Drinking Water Act Count
SDWARows.description: The number of facilities or cases within the results set that have Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA) permits.

PageNo.description: The number of pages of results returned

EnforcementCases.description: A complex array of enforcement case information.

PageNo.description: The number of pages of results returned

Facilities.title: Facilities
Facilities.description: A complex array of facility information.

RegistryID.title: FRS ID
RegistryID.description: An internal 12-digit Facility Registry Service (FRS) tracking number used to tie all facility data together in EPA regulatory program databases.

FacilityStreet.title: Facility Street
FacilityStreet.description: The street address of the facility

FacilityCity.title: Facility City
FacilityCity.description: The city in which the facility is located

FacilityState.title: Facility State
FacilityState.description: The state in which the facility is located

EPASystem.title: EPA Data System
EPASystem.description:
The EPA data system in which permit and facility records are kept. EPA's Facility Registry System (FRS) links all program database records (such as permit IDs and IDs facilities use in reporting to EPA) together. The following list describes the individual data systems that are linked to from the detailed facility report: 

- AFS: Air Facility System for Clean Air Act stationary source programs.
- ICP: Integrated Compliance Information System for Clean Water Act programs monitoring National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permits.
- RCR: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information System (RCRAInfo) for tracking the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) programs.
- NCDB: National Compliance Database System for monitoring national performance of the Toxic Substance Control Act (TSCA); the Emergency Planning and Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 (EPCRA); the Asbestos Hazard Emergency Response (AHERA); and the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA).
- TRI: Toxics Release Inventory for Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 submissions.
- NEI: National Emissions Inventory database contains information on stationary and mobile sources that emit criteria air pollutants and their precursors, as well as hazardous air pollutants (HAPs). The database includes estimates of annual emissions, by source, of air pollutants in each area of the country, on an annual basis.
- TSCA: Toxic Substances Control Act addressing the production, importation, use, and disposal of specific chemicals.

QtrsInSNC.title: Quarters In Significant Noncompliance
QtrsInSNC.description: The number of formal enforcement actions that have been taken against the facility, under the corresponding statute, within the five year time period

css09.description: EPA Open Civil Enforcement Cases Object

CaseNumber.title: Case Number
CaseNumber.description: A unique number identifying the enforcement action. For EPA civil cases, these numbers begin with either the two digit EPA Region Code, "HQ" (headquarters initiated cases), and "EF" or "WF" (Eastern or Western Field Office CAA Mobile Source Program cases); followed by the fiscal year in which the action was initiated. After the fiscal year there is a sequence number. State NPDES civil cases start with the two character post abbreviation, followed by a sequence number.

CaseName.title: Case Name
CaseName.description:
A unique number identifying the enforcement action. For EPA civil cases, these numbers begin with either the two digit EPA Region Code, "HQ" (headquarters initiated cases), and "EF" or "WF" (Eastern or Western Field Office CAA Mobile Source Program cases); followed by the fiscal year in which the action was initiated. After the fiscal year there is a sequence number. State NPDES civil cases start with the two character post abbreviation, followed by a sequence number.
For criminal cases, the ID was generated in ECHO based on the following format: CR [prosecution_summary_id]. The source of the Prosecution Summary ID is the Summary of Criminal Prosecutions database.

CaseType.title: Case Type
CaseType.description: The unique code that identifies a type of compliance event or enforcement action.

CaseStatus.title: Case Status
CaseStatus.description: The status of the compliance event or enforcement action.

StatusDate.title: Case Status Date
StatusDate.description: The date of the most recent milestone activity reported in the case record.
